titleInfo.title: (PC) Chatman v. Felker, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER re 16 F&R's filed 3/31/05 are hereby VACATED. Further proceedings are stayed until the 9th Circuit rules in Chatman v Early, 04-17442. Pltf is directed to file further status report at 60 day intervals until his appeal is decided. Within 30 days of the decision in Chatman v. Early, 04-17442, pltf shall notify this court and file a motion to lift the stay, signed by Judge Kimberly J. Mueller on 4/22/05. (Kastilahn, A)

extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California

Early, 04-17442, pltf shall notify this court and file a motion to lift the stay, signed by Judge Kimberly J. Mueller on 4/22/05. (Kastilahn, A)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Chatman v. Felker, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Judge Kimberly J. Mueller ORDERING 1 Application to Proceed in IFP by Charles James Chatman is GRANTED. Pltf is obligated to pay the $150.00 filing fee in accordance with the court's order filed concurrently herewith. Service is appropriate for dfts: Turner, Weaver, Goforth, Dharlinque, Roberts, Peddicard, Wright, Amero, Beckman, Panerio, Zills, Rohlfing, Runnels and Brown. Clerk shall send pltf 14 USM forms, summons, instructions and copy of the 12/27/04 complaint. Pltf shall complete documents and submit to court for service w/i 30 days from date of this order. The stay ended 4/22/05 and is hereby LIFTED. (Waggoner, D) Modified on 10/27/2005 (Waggoner, D).

titleInfo.title: (PC) Chatman v. Felker, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Judge Kimberly J. Mueller ORDERING Direct of CDC shall collect initial partial filing fee of $5.00 from pltf's inmate trust account. Thereafter the balance of $150.00 shall be collected in monthly payments equal to 20% of preceding month's income credit. Clerk shall serve CDC&CFS.(Waggoner, D)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Chatman v. Felker, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER AND FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS signed by Magistrate Judge Kimberly J. Mueller on 1/22/09: ORDERING that Plaintiff's request to dismiss defendants Brown and Dharlingue from the action is granted 103. Plaintiff's motion for a temporary restraining order is denied 116. Plaintiff's motion for a telephonic conference is denied 124. Plaintiff's motion to compel is granted in part and denied in part 99. RECOMMENDING that plaintiff's motion for injunctive relief be denied 123. Objections to F&R due within twenty days. (Kaminski, H) Modified on 4/22/2009 (Kaminski, H).

titleInfo.title: (PC) Chatman v. Felker, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Judge John A. Mendez on 3/25/2011 ADOPTING 152 Findings and Recommendations in full. The 139 Motion to Dismiss is GRANTED as to dfts Amero and Runnels. The Motion is DENIED as to dfts Zillis, Pontarolo, Turner, Weaver and Goforth. Pltf's 153 Pre-Trial Statement is deemed timely filed. titleInfo.title: (PC) Chatman v. Felker, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: RESPONSE to Note #3 from the Jury, by Judge John A. Mendez on 6/17/13. 1. The court will read the questions and answers to intorratories nos. 16 and 17 which were introduced during Mr. Chatman's direct examination of Defendant Beckman. 2. The plaintiff is required to prove all five elements by a preponderance of the evidence. (Becknal, R)
